Key Match Events: The Knicks allowed the Nets to shoot 41 percent from the three-point line.
New York was able to hold Brooklyn's Dennis Schroder to 2-11 shooting from the floor for eight points, and Cam Thomas to 4-11 shooting from the field for 16 points.
Pre-Game Insights: Mikal Bridges openly called for his Knicks to “set the tone early” and all be better individually so they could thrive as a unit.
Post-Match Reflections: The Knicks' starters put up one of their best games as a unit, as four of them scored 20 or more points.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Knicks (7-6) are now winners of two straight and slowly but surely gelling.
Others: Karl-Anthony Towns led the way with 26 points, 15 rebounds, and six assists while OG Anunoby followed close behind with 24 points and Josh Hart pitched in 20.
